newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 12.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- President Jacques Chirac on a visit to Poland calls for opening of European Union to Eastern European countries, wants Poland to join by 2000.
-- Former Economy Minister Edmond Alphandery, chairman of EDF state-owned electricity supplier, announces a concentration of decision-making processes.
-- E.U. commission could include principle of general public interest in its official documents, to protect the idea of public service while favouring economic liberalisation.
-- Association of French banks unenthusiastic over possible bid by savings bank Caisses d'Epargne for privatisation of CIC bank, on grounds that they are state-backed.
-- BNP posts 1996 first-half profits up 80 percent from 1995 H1 at 1.74 billion francs.
-- Credit Lyonnais workers demonstrate today against against planned job cuts.
